page.title: 01 General Introduction
page.content: Our study area has taken us to a part of Cheshire , where old world charm has survived the profitable inroads of industry and is regarded by many as a jewel in Cheshire's crown. Swettenham village has gained regional fame for its Daffodil Dell to which many visitors trek in the Spring to enjoy the blaze of floral colours. A fairy tale atmosphere is heightened by the presence of an ancient mill where there is a wishing well and items of wood craft for sale. Through our survey , it was clear to see that Swettenham is very much a farming parish whose lanes lead to a quaint old church , an old inn and the mill.
